Paragraph.Text: the discovery, on board an aircraft, of an explosive substance or an incendiary device in respect of which the air carrier was not notified in accordance with subsection 80(3), other than ammunition permitted under subsections 79(2.1) to (2.4) or ammunition that the air carrier authorized under section 533.1;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an explosion on an aircraft, unless the explosion is known to be the result of an accident;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a threat against an aircraft, flight, or part of an aerodrome or other aviation facility, that is under the air carrier’s control; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an aviation security incident that involves a peace officer in any part of an aerodrome that is under the air carrier’s control.

Subsection.Text: An air carrier must immediately notify the operator of an aerodrome when a weapon, other than a firearm permitted under subsection 78(2), is detected in any part of the aerodrome that is under the air carrier’s control.

Section.Text: An air carrier must provide the Minister, on reasonable notice given by the Minister, with written or electronic records or any other information relevant to the security of the air carrier’s operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information concerning the method of implementing a security measure, emergency direction or interim order that applies to the air carrier; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the nature of the operations related to a particular flight and the services provided in respect of the flight.

Section.Text: A person who provides an air carrier with a service and a person who provides a service related to the transportation of accepted cargo or mail by air must provide the Minister, on reasonable notice given by the Minister, with written or electronic records or any other information relevant to the security of the air carrier’s operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information concerning the method of implementing a security measure, emergency direction or interim order that applies to that person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the nature of the operations related to a particular flight and the services provided in respect of the flight.

Heading.Label: PART 11
Heading.TitleText: Cargo and Mail — Flights from Canada

Subsection.Text: Section 669 applies to air carriers who transport cargo on a flight departing from an aerodrome located in Canada.
Sections 670 to 686 apply to the following members of the air cargo security program who screen cargo or store, tender or transport secure cargo:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: regulated agents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: certified agents; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: known consignors.

Subsection.Text: Cargo that is to be transported by an air carrier on a flight must be screened by the air carrier for threat items in accordance with a security measure unless the cargo was tendered to the air carrier for transportation by air as secure cargo.
An air carrier must not transport cargo on a flight if the cargo contains a threat item.

Section.MarginalNote: Tendering of secure cargo — regulated agents and certified agents
Section.Text: A regulated agent or certified agent must not tender cargo for transportation by air as secure cargo unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the regulated agent

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has screened the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has restricted access to the cargo in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has ensured that the cargo was not tampered with after it was screened for threat items; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the regulated agent or certified agent has screened it in order to verify that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cargo was screened for threat items in accordance with a security measure,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cargo was not tampered with after it was screened for threat items.

Section.MarginalNote: Tendering of secure cargo — known consignors
Section.Text: A known consignor must not tender cargo for transportation by air as secure cargo unless the known consignor

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has screened the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has restricted access to the cargo in accordance with sections 675 to 677; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has ensured that the cargo was not tampered with after it was screened for threat items.

Subsection.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must not tender cargo for transportation by air as secure cargo unless the cargo is accompanied by the information referred to in subsection (2), (3) or (4), as applicable, in paper or electronic format.
If the cargo is tendered by a regulated agent referred to in paragraph 670(a), the information that accompanies the cargo must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of non-consolidated cargo

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the air waybill number or the number of a similar control document,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s air cargo security program number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the original shipper of the cargo, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration by one of the regulated agent’s authorized cargo representatives stating that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an authorized cargo representative has screened the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure and no threat items were found in the cargo,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the cargo was not tampered with between the time it was screened for threat items and the time it was tendered; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of consolidated cargo

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the air waybill number or the number of a similar control document,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s air cargo security program number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration by one of the regulated agent’s authorized cargo representatives stating that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an authorized cargo representative has screened the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure and no threat items were found in the cargo,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the cargo was not tampered with between the time it was screened for threat items and the time it was tendered.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Tendering by regulated agents or certified agents
Subsection.Text: If the cargo is tendered by a regulated agent or certified agent referred to in paragraph 670(b), the information that accompanies the cargo must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of non-consolidated cargo

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information that accompanied the cargo when the cargo was accepted by the regulated agent or certified agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the air waybill number or the number of a similar control document, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s air cargo security program number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration by one of the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s authorized cargo representatives stating that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the cargo was not tampered with between the time it was screened for threat items and the time it was tendered;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of consolidated cargo

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the air waybill number or the number of a similar control document,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s air cargo security program number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration by one of the regulated agent’s or certified agent’s authorized cargo representatives stating that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the cargo was not tampered with between the time it was screened for threat items and the time it was tendered.

Subsection.Text: If the cargo is tendered by a known consignor referred to in section 671, the information that accompanies the cargo must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the air waybill number or the number of a similar control document,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the known consignor’s name,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the known consignor’s air cargo security program number, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration by one of the known consignor’s authorized cargo representatives stating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an authorized cargo representative has screened the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure and no threat items were found in the cargo,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: access to the cargo was restricted in accordance with sections 675 to 677, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cargo was not tampered with between the time it was screened for threat items and the time it was tendered.

Section.Text: A person must not screen cargo unless the person is designated by the Minister or is an authorized cargo representative of the designated person.

Subsection.Text: If a regulated agent or known consignor screens cargo for threat items in order for it to be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo, the regulated agent or known consignor must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct the screening in accordance with a security measure;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct the screening in an area that the regulated agent or known consignor has designated for that purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, while the screening is being conducted, signs are in place at or near the designated area that state, in both official languages, that unauthorized access to the area is prohibited;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: control access to the designated area while the screening is being conducted to ensure that, subject to subsection (2), only an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent or known consignor has access to the area;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: take measures to detect unauthorized individuals in the designated area while the screening is being conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, while the screening is being conducted, individuals other than an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent or known consignor do not have access to cargo in the designated area; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, while the screening is being conducted, cargo in the designated area is not tampered with.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is not an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent or known consignor is permitted in the designated area if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is acting in the course of their employment and requires access to the designated area while screenings are being conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has the prior approval of the cargo security coordinator of the regulated agent or known consignor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the cargo security coordinator or one of the regulated agent’s or known consignor’s authorized cargo representatives verifies the identity of the individual by means of government-issued photo identification provided by the individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is, while in the designated area, escorted and kept under surveillance by an authorized cargo representative who has been assigned to that task by the regulated agent or known consignor.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (2)(d), the regulated agent or known consignor must ensure that the authorized cargo representative does not escort more than 10 individuals at one time.
If cargo is screened in order for it to be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo, a regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor who stores the cargo must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: store the cargo in an area that they have designated for that purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, while the cargo is stored in the designated area, signs are in place at or near the area that state, in both official languages, that unauthorized access to the area is prohibited;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: control access to the designated area while the cargo is stored in the area to ensure that, subject to subsection (2), only an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor has access to the area;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take measures to detect unauthorized individuals in the designated area while the cargo is stored in the area;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, while the cargo is stored in the designated area, individuals other than an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor do not have access to cargo in the designated area; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the cargo is not tampered with while it is stored in the designated area.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is not an authorized cargo representative of the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor is permitted in the designated area if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is acting in the course of their employment and requires access to the designated area while cargo, which has been screened in order that it may be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo, is stored in the area;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has the prior approval of the cargo security coordinator of the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the cargo security coordinator, or one of the authorized cargo representatives of the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor, verifies the identity of the individual by means of government-issued photo identification provided by the individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is, while in the designated area, escorted and kept under surveillance by an authorized cargo representative who has been assigned to that task by the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (2)(d), the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must ensure that the authorized cargo representative does not escort more than 10 individuals at one time.

Section.Text: If cargo is screened in order for it to be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo, the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor who transports the cargo must, in accordance with a security measure,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the cargo is transported by one or more of their authorized cargo representatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is no unauthorized access to the cargo during transport.

Section.Text: [Reserved, SOR/2019-149, s. 2]

Heading.TitleText: Cargo Security Coordinators and Authorized Cargo Representatives

Subsection.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must designate a cargo security coordinator who is responsible for coordinating and overseeing compliance with the regulatory requirements that apply to the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor and for acting as the principal contact between the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor and the Minister with respect to aviation security matters.

The regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must not designate an individual as cargo security coordinator unless that individual is an authorized cargo representative and a senior manager or supervisor.
A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must not designate an individual as an authorized cargo representative unless the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is employed by the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a security clearance or has undergone a background check that indicates that the individual does not pose a risk to aviation security; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has been trained in relation to their duties as an authorized cargo representative.

Subsection.Text: If the individual undergoes a background check for the purposes of paragraph (1)(b), the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must ensure that the background check includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Canadian criminal record check;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the individual’s home addresses for the five years preceding the date of the background check; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the individual’s work history for the five years preceding the date of the background check.

Section.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must, at least once every five years, conduct a Canadian criminal record check on any of their authorized cargo representatives that do not have a security clearance.
A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must immediately notify the Minister if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: detect a threat item in cargo while screening it in order for it to be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: detect unauthorized access to cargo in their possession that is being screened or has been screened in order that it may be tendered for transportation by air as secure cargo;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: detect signs of tampering with cargo in their possession that is being screened or has been screened in order that it may be tendered for transportion by air as secure cargo; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: become aware of any other aviation security incident involving cargo that is or was in their possession.

Section.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor who tenders cargo for transportation by air as secure cargo must keep a copy of the information referred to in subsection 672(2), (3) or (4), as applicable, for at least 90 days after the day on which they cease to be in possession of the cargo.

Subsection.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must keep a training record, in paper or electronic format, for each authorized cargo representative.
A training record for an authorized cargo representative must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the authorized cargo representative;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their position title;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the dates on which they received training in relation to their duties as an authorized cargo representative;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of those duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the trainer.

Subsection.Text: The regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must keep the training record for at least 90 days after the day on which the authorized cargo representative ceases to act in that capacity.

If an individual undergoes a background check for the purposes of paragraph 680(1)(b) and is designated as an authorized cargo representative, the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must keep a record in respect of the background check that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the background check; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person or organization that conducted the background check.

Subsection.Text: If the individual ceases to act as an authorized cargo representative, the regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor must keep the record for at least 90 days after the day on which the authorized cargo representative ceases to act in that capacity.

Section.Text: A regulated agent, certified agent or known consignor who keeps a record or information under this Part must make the record or information available to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Mail that is to be transported by an air carrier on a flight departing from an aerodrome located in Canada must be screened by the air carrier for threat items in accordance with a security measure.
An air carrier must not transport mail on a flight departing from an aerodrome located in Canada if the mail contains a threat item.

Section.Text: This Part applies to air carriers who transport cargo on a flight departing from a place outside Canada to an aerodrome located in Canada. This Part does not apply in respect of diplomatic or consular bags.

Subsection.Text: An air carrier must provide to the Minister, before cargo is loaded on board the aircraft, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the air waybill number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each original shipper;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each consignee;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of each piece of cargo;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the number of pieces;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the total weight of the cargo.

Subsection.Text: If there are any changes to the information, the air carrier must, as soon as feasible, provide the updated information to the Minister.
The air carrier must provide to the Minister, on request, any additional information respecting the cargo so that the aviation security risk may be assessed.
At the request of the Minister, an air carrier must screen the cargo for threat items in accordance with a security measure.
If the cargo contains a threat item, the air carrier must immediately establish control of the cargo and must remove any threat to aviation security.
After any screening carried out under subsection (1), the air carrier must provide the Minister with the following information before the flight’s departure from the last point of departure:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the screening methods used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date and time of the screening;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the air waybill number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the cargo contained a threat item, the action taken to remove the threat.

Section.Text: An air carrier must not transport cargo on a flight unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has confirmed receipt of the information referred to in subsection 741(1) and, if applicable, subsection 741(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has confirmed that no further action is to be taken after the assessment of the additional information provided under subsection 741(3);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has not issued a “Do Not Load” notice in respect of the cargo; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has confirmed that no further action is to be taken after the assessment of the information provided under subsection 742(3).

Section.Text: An air carrier must provide the following information to the Minister as soon as feasible after a flight’s departure from the last point of departure and before its arrival in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the flight;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the flight number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destination aerodrome;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the departure time;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the air waybill numbers for the flight.

Section.Text: An air carrier must provide to the Minister the name and contact information of the person who is acting as the principal contact between the air carrier and the Minister. The air carrier must ensure that the person is available at all times.
This Part sets out ministerial powers and duties that are not set out in any other part.

The Minister is authorized to disclose to CATSA or the operator of an aerodrome any information that is necessary for the proper operation of the identity verification system referred to in section 56.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must ask CATSA to deactivate a restricted area identity card if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is notified under section 156 or 312; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the security clearance of the person to whom the card has been issued is suspended or cancelled.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not ask CATSA to deactivate a restricted area identity card for a reason other than a reason set out in subsection (1).

Section.Text: This Division applies in respect of aerodromes listed in Schedules 1 to 3, or any part of those aerodromes, and in respect of any other place designated by the Minister under subsection 6(1.1) of the Canadian Air Transport Security Authority Act.
Unless it is raised, lowered or maintained in accordance with this Division, the AVSEC level for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome is level 1. At that level, normal operating conditions apply.
The Minister must raise or lower to level 2 the AVSEC level for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is made aware of a heightened risk condition related to an elevated risk; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is likely, based on available information, that additional safeguards at the aerodrome or a part of the aerodrome will mitigate the heightened risk condition.

Section.Text: The Minister must raise to level 3 the AVSEC level for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is made aware of a heightened risk condition related to a critical or imminent risk; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is likely, based on available information, that additional safeguards at the aerodrome or a part of the aerodrome will mitigate the heightened risk condition.

Section.Text: The Minister must, as soon as a heightened risk condition no longer applies, lower to level 1 an AVSEC level that has been raised for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome.
The Minister is authorized to maintain an AVSEC level that has been raised for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome if the criteria for raising the AVSEC level continue to apply.
If the Minister raises, lowers or maintains the AVSEC level for an aerodrome or any part of an aerodrome, the Minister must immediately notify the operator of the aerodrome. The notice must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: include information about the heightened risk condition; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: specify a date on which the AVSEC level is likely to return to level 1.

Section.Text: For greater certainty, nothing in this Division prohibits the Minister from raising, lowering or maintaining the AVSEC level for more than one aerodrome at a time.

Subsection.Text: This Part allows the enforcement, by means of administrative monetary penalties, of the provisions of these Regulations that are set out in Schedule 4 and the provisions of any security measure.
The Designated Provisions Regulations allow the enforcement, by means of administrative monetary penalties, of the provisions of the Act that are set out in Schedule 4 to those Regulations.

A provision set out in column 1 of Schedule 4 is designated as a provision the contravention of which may be dealt with under and in accordance with the procedure set out in sections 7.7 to 8.2 of the Act.

The amount set out in column 2 or column 3 of Schedule 4 is prescribed as the maximum amount payable by an individual or corporation, as the case may be, in respect of a contravention of the provision set out in column 1.
The provisions of a security measure are designated as provisions the contravention of which may be dealt with under and in accordance with the procedure set out in sections 7.7 to 8.2 of the Act.
The maximum amount payable in respect of a contravention of a designated provision referred to in subsection (1) is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $5,000, in the case of an individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $25,000, in the case of a corporation.

Section.Text: A notice referred to in subsection 7.7(1) of the Act must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be in writing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set out the particulars of the alleged contravention;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: state that the person on whom the notice is served or to whom it is sent has the option of paying the amount specified in the notice or filing with the Tribunal a request for a review of the alleged contravention or the amount of the penalty;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: state that payment of the amount specified in the notice will be accepted by the Minister in satisfaction of the amount of the penalty for the alleged contravention and that no further proceedings under Part I of the Act will be taken against the person on whom the notice in respect of that contravention is served or to whom it is sent;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: state that the person on whom the notice is served or to whom it is sent will be provided with an opportunity consistent with procedural fairness and natural justice to present evidence before the Tribunal and make representations in relation to the alleged contravention if the person files a request for a review with the Tribunal; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: state that the person on whom the notice is served or to whom it is sent will be deemed to have committed the contravention set out in the notice if the person fails to pay the amount specified in the notice and fails to file a request for a review with the Tribunal within the prescribed period.

Subsection.Text: Sections 196 and 199 do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until December 15, 2014.
Sections 197 and 198 do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until March 15, 2015.
The following provisions do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until April 15, 2015:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections 115 to 118; and

Paragraph.Text: paragraph 206(1)(c).

Subsection.Text: Sections 202 and 204 do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until February 15, 2016.
The following provisions do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until May 15, 2016:

Paragraph.Text: sections 97 and 98;

Paragraph.Label: (d)

Subsection.Text: The following provisions do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until April 15, 2015:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections 271 to 274; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)

The following provisions do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until September 15, 2016:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections 426 to 429; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 474(1)(c).

Subsection.Text: Sections 472 and 473 do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until September 15, 2016.
The following provisions do not apply to the operator of an aerodrome until March 15, 2017:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
